definitions.definition: a wild plant growing where it is not wanted, especially among crops or garden plants

examples.text: The yard was overgrown with weeds.
Routine maintenance of the garden consists of keeping weeds under control.
There were weeds pushing up through the gravel.

definitions.definition: any wild plant without flowers that grows in water and forms a green floating mass

examples.text: I wish I could give up the weed *(= stop smoking)*.

definitions.definition: a person with a weak character or body
with more problems, work or commitments than you can manage

examples.text: The bartender was alone and in the weeds, so we had to wait twenty minutes to order.

definitions.definition: too concerned with the details of something

examples.text: I don't want to get too **deep in the weeds** here, but here's the short version:…

wordOrigin: Old English wēod (noun), wēodian (verb), of unknown origin; related to Dutch wieden (verb).
